abstract.0: Manufacturers are looking to digital transformation and Industry 4.0 to help cut costs, improve efficiencies, improve customer service, and even help develop new revenue models. But where to start? Getting connected is only the beginning. How do you make use of increased data? In this session learn how to implement Industry 4.0 one step at a time. See a live factory feed showing production and asset status for a highly automated robotic factory along with hearing how Noble Plastics is using this technology to manage a completely touchless third factory shift. Also, hear industry leaders from Cisco, Mazda, Cohu, and Infosys describe what they are doing to help transform their businesses to prepare for the future. This lively session offers real actionable ideas that you can use to transform your manufacturing business.
abstract.1: Is the utilities sector ready to embrace innovation? While electric, gas, and water utilities each found their beginnings in brilliant technology inventions, it is innovation rather than invention that is going to pave the way for the future utility. Today's utility business model is being undermined both by big bang disruption and by more gradual, compression disruption, causing a monumental shift in the dynamics of the industry that can neither be avoided nor ignored. In this keynote session, hear about the challenges utilities are facing, the necessity of applying new innovation to the issues, and the unprecedented opportunities for thriving, sustainable new business models for the future.
abstract.2: Colleges and universities are embarking on a journey of technological transformation to deliver a new breed of campus experiences. Oracle provides the most comprehensive solutions for college campuses today with new and engaging cloud services for the entire student and employee lifecycle.  Join this session to hear from higher ed leaders at Birmingham City University, Central State University, and Houston Community College as they share their foresight  and journey to the cloud.
abstract.3: It’s more urgent than ever for businesses to begin their cloud journeys today. In this panel session hear from Oracle thought leaders, customers, and industry experts on how to jumpstart or accelerate your transformation and drive sustained leadership in your industry.
abstract.4: Marketing technologies help us stay connected to customers by providing the tools to remain relatable and relevant. Adopting and implementing innovative marketing strategies leveraging new technologies can transform the buyer's journey and help you meet the increasing demands of customers. In this session learn how Oracle's latest advancements in marketing tech provide new opportunities to use data and analytics to gain more insights about your customers, create more relevant conversations, and propel your organization toward better customer experiences with higher conversions that differentiate you from the competition.
abstract.5: Oracle IT is on a similar transformational journey as many of our customers. With a strategy to be a 100% cloud-only IT shop, we made significant gains during our implementation of a Next Generation Contact Center Solution on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. Oracle’s CIO Mark Sunday will share insights on how Oracle IT, which serves over 130,000 end users, successfully achieved this in only one year. Mark will walk through the key stages that most implementations have in common: planning, moving, operating, and future deployments - focusing on the valuable lessons learned along the way towards an all-in cloud strategy. This is a can't miss session for IT Executives and Professionals.
abstract.6: Customer expectations are constantly evolving and the cost of regulation and compliance is on the rise, forcing financial institutions to double down on their efforts to provide a compelling experience that improves customer engagement. Financial institutions also must manage increasing volumes of data and externalize their services through APIs. These opportunities can be addressed with a progressive transformation strategy for creating a foundation for the business that will enables companies to embrace the future without technology debt. This session looks at the impact of transformation efforts across the business, while addressing customer experience, product processing, compliance, financial risk, and regulatory reporting.
abstract.7: What does the future hold for sales professionals? The advent of artificial intelligence, chatbots, voice technology, and next-generation analytics is transforming the customer experience. In this session hear how sales reps, managers, and executives manage day-to-day operations and strategic planning. Hear from special guest, Multichoice, Africa’s leading video entertainment company as they plan their transformation to unify sales, service, campaigns and marketing for a 360 view and engagement with customers.
abstract.8:
This session is reserved for executive-level Oracle partners who have received a personalized invitation. Please work with your Oracle A&C representatives for nominations. Set the tone for an exciting week of Oracle OpenWorld by kicking off the conference with messaging designed specifically for the Oracle partner community. Hear directly from Oracle executives about strategic insights, go-to-market opportunities for all partner types, tools to gain momentum for your business, Oracle PartnerNetwork updates, and more. Partner panelists also share real-world success stories around developing, selling, implementing, and managing Oracle solutions.
Private reception follows.
abstract.9: Consumers of analytics are in for big changes because Oracle is at the early stages of the next big wave of innovation: automated analytics. What once required hand-crafted efforts and specialized skills (limiting who used the information) is now significantly augmented with recommendations, predictions, natural language, and new insights—all to leapfrog the status quo. The result: greater productivity, smarter decisions, and faster time to action for business, as well as lower cost, nimbler innovation, and reduced support from IT. In this session learn about innovations brought about by Oracle Analytics, what customers are doing now, and what changes you should expect in the future.
abstract.10: The most effective leaders in today’s digital age know how to include diverse perspectives to achieve better results. This program—hosted by the Diversity and Inclusion and Oracle Women’s Leadership teams—invites thought leaders to learn about the importance of creating a workforce where all employees feel valued, heard, and encouraged to contribute. Join us to participate in a discussion with leaders that will challenge and inspire us to engage and develop talent to build leaders of the future.
abstract.11: Customer service is undergoing an exciting evolution as companies embrace the strategic principles of experience and centricity. This evolution is pushing companies to think beyond accepted boundaries and design customer experiences that have relevance today and elasticity for the future. In this session Learn Oracle’s product vision and see how key technologies such as IoT, augmented and mixed reality, predictive analytics, and robotics surface Oracle’s CX product suite into a single immersive experience.
abstract.12: Hear directly from Oracle senior executives, as well as from leading partners, about opportunities for independent software vendors (ISVs) to accelerate growth, access new market opportunities, and increase revenue running on Oracle Cloud. Learn what differentiates Oracle from other public cloud providers, and hear how software companies like yours are leveraging value-added programs, resources, and commercial models designed specifically for ISVs.
abstract.13: How confident are you about your journey to the cloud? Are you moving fast enough to keep up with your competitors, your clients, and your people? In this session learn from one of Oracle’s most innovative clients on how moving to the cloud can catapult success. Oracle Consulting transformed delivery to the cloud to produce rapid results through vigor, discipline, accountability, and differentiated assets to accelerate implementation with exceptional results: on time and under budget—with differentiated capabilities producing real results to the bottom line from day one. Discover how Oracle help you deliver and operate differently in the cloud.
abstract.14: Companies today have three sometimes conflicting mandates: modernize, innovate, AND reduce costs. The right cloud platform can address all three, but migrating isn’t always as easy as it sounds because everyone’s needs are unique, and cookie-cutter approaches just don’t work. Oracle Cloud Platform makes it possible to develop your own unique path to the cloud however you choose—SaaS, PaaS, or IaaS. In this session learn how Oracle Cloud Platform repairs and secures, allowing you to reduce costs and risk while at the same time delivering greater insights and innovation for your organization. Learn from colleagues who found success building their own unique paths to the cloud.
abstract.15: Join this session for a discussion on how leading communications and digital service providers are meeting the needs of today’s digital customers through smart ecosystems. Customers expect intuitive digital experiences and services in all aspects and locations of their lives. Hear how a panel of Oracle Communications customers are using Oracle solutions to deploy high-margin ecosystems such as smart cities, smart workplaces, smart homes, and smart cars—all powered by smart networks. This session highlights these successes and showcases Oracle Communications’ investments in transformative technologies to deliver 5G and next-generation solutions.
abstract.16: Oracle E-Business Suite customers want the confidence of knowing that that their choice of integrated, global business applications will continue to enable better decisions, reduce costs, and increase performance. In this session get an update on the Oracle E-Business Suite product line. Learn about the benefits you can expect to receive from both cloud and on-premises Oracle E-Business Suite investments. Come away with an understanding of the value Oracle E-Business Suite applications deliver now and in the future.
abstract.17: A highly motivated and productive workforce is essential for any agile and dynamic organization. Antiquated employee engagement processes are being replaced with modern HR systems to significantly enhance the employee workforce experience. In this session learn how Cognizant is helping customers transform into a digital HR enterprise leveraging Oracle HCM Cloud as the foundation.  Building on this foundation, Cognizant further enhances the customer experience through intelligent bots, analytics, and IoT.
abstract.18: In this session hear about the recent major changes for Oracle’s PeopleSoft solutions and learn about the future vision and ongoing support for PeopleSoft. That vision includes ongoing investments in the modern user experience, regular delivery of easy-to-consume new product features, and ways to enable low-cost, highly agile development operations. Hear about Oracle's continued focus on gaining value from deploying PeopleSoft to Oracle Cloud IaaS as well as new focus areas including greater configurability in and how emerging technologies such as AI, machine learning, and chatbots are on PeopleSoft's horizon. The session also includes an outline of Oracle's commitment to long-term support of PeopleSoft.
abstract.19: Project work today reflects the modern enterprise: collaborative, mobile, and data-driven. Organizations that aren’t using the cloud-based tools required for project managers and team members to succeed in this fast-paced environment are being outperformed by those that do. The most successful organizations have elevated their project management to the enterprise level for immediate insight and analysis, and data-based execution. In this session hear how leading organizations are exceeding project expectations in a competitive enterprise environment with Oracle Project Portfolio Management Cloud.
abstract.20: Rapid technological advances are driving profound change at every level within the public sector around the globe. Cloud computing and IoT is enabling government to deliver digital services to citizens and businesses via their channel of choice. On the back end, supporting processes are automated and providing the operational agility and savings to fuel ongoing innovation. Sophisticated cloud analytics, combined with AI and machine learning, are helping public sector officials adopt a more proactive approach to policy-making and government service delivery. Attend this session to hear Oracle and Accenture’s vision for the public sector, and gain valuable insights from public sector officials who have made the journey to the cloud.
abstract.21: Retail continues to be mercurial as consumers react and adapt to technological developments. With modern technologies predicting, dictating, and mirroring the twenty-first-century shopper, retailers are having to make tough decisions about tech investments to keep pace with a shifting marketplace that reaches across continents and cultures. Join Oracle and Accenture in this session to learn more about the global consumer trends and the latest innovations in the market that help brands win the battle to acquire and retain customers.
abstract.22: Join this session for the State of the Dolphin keynote address. Learn about the latest innovations in MySQL 8.0, MySQL security, Oracle MySQL Cloud Service, and MySQL analytics service.
abstract.23: Organizations are under tremendous pressure to lower cost, reduce risk, and accelerate innovation. In this session learn how Oracle Autonomous Database Cloud is helping customers achieve these objectives by leveraging the most valuable currency of the company: data. With its self-driving, self-repairing, and self-securing capabilities using machine leaning, all stakeholders including executives, business users, and data analysts can gain insights for smarter business decisions, and IT can deploy applications in minutes for faster innovation. Learn why Larry Ellison calls Oracle Autonomous Database Cloud "the most important thing we have done in a long time." See how it is revolutionizing data management and empowering line of business, DBAs, and data scientists, to do more with data.
abstract.24: Modern procurement systems and business practices offer significant opportunities for cost savings, process improvement, and value creation for your organization. This session covers key trends, best practices, and the latest Oracle strategies and innovations.
abstract.25: Are you an Oracle Commerce customer looking to build on your success? Join this exciting general session that highlights Oracle's current and future innovations and how they align to key trends in digital commerce. Oracle’s heads of innovation and development show you how to leverage Oracle Commerce products to deliver personalized, intelligent B2C and B2B digital commerce experiences through a series of innovation vignettes. See how to connect those experiences across channels to enable a comprehensive commerce journey from awareness and acquisition to fulfillment and service.

1.bio:
Rodger E. Smith joined Oracle Corporation in 2011 as Senior Vice President and General Manager for the Oracle Utilities Global Business Unit.  He is responsible for leading a global  team that includes  sales, services, product development, R&D, industry strategy and marketing for mission-critical applications and services designed specifically for electric, gas and water utilities worldwide.  Smith oversees a leading edge portfolio of the most complete, end-to-end solutions available in the industry today, that includes customer care and billing, network management, work and asset management, field services, meter data management and analytics, serving the entire utility value chain from the meter to the grid to the end customer.  He is committed to technology innovation and digital transformation, and to helping energy and utility companies improve customer experience and achieve operational excellence.  
Prior to joining Oracle, Smith served as President of the Enterprise Management Solutions Division of Black & Veatch, and the Global Marketing Communications & Government Affairs Units (2003-2011).  In addition to leading these businesses, Smith was a member of the Executive Committee.         
Smith also served as a Director for PricewaterhouseCoopers (1997-2002), the world’s largest management consulting and professional services firm.   He was responsible for the development, delivery and marketing of management consulting products and services to the utilities industry.  
Prior to his experience with PricewaterhouseCoopers, Smith was employed in various capacities by Southern Company, Inc. (1981-1997), one of the nation’s largest electric utility companies.

David is the Divisional Chief Information Officer of Smart Grid Operations.  Prior to this role, David served as the Director of PGE's Customer Touchpoints project, which replaced a legacy Customer Information and Meter Data Management system with Oracle's CC&B and MDM products, among others.  David is a guitar player and active backpacker who enjoys time with his wife, children, and dogs.

1.bio:
Jack Azagury is a senior managing director leading Accenture’s Resources business in North America serving the utilities, energy, chemicals and natural resources industries. He is also a member of Accenture’s Global Leadership Council and North America Leadership Team. 

Prior to his current role, he led Accenture’s North America utilities business, served as the global lead for Accenture's Smart Grid Services business, led Accenture’s Management Consulting practice for North America Resources and led Accenture’s North America utilities strategy practice. 

Azagury has advised utilities globally on large-scale business transformations, smart grid programs, mergers and acquisitions, and corporate and business unit strategies. He is a frequent speaker at conferences and has published numerous articles on the future of the utilities industry, the attributes of high performing utilities, and the transformation towards a distributed and digitally enabled grid. 

Azagury joined Accenture in 1996 in London and was elected Partner in 2003. Prior to joining Accenture, Azagury worked on strategy and business development in the software industry in the United Kingdom, United States and Japan. 

Azagury holds a Master of Software Engineering degree from Imperial College London and a Master of Business Administration degree from INSEAD.

1.bio: Jay directs American Electric Power’s Customer Experience Program, which includes definition of CX strategy as well as prioritization and oversight of customer improvement initiatives across the enterprise.  He also leads the build-out and operation of AEP's Voice of the Customer organization.  AEP is one of the largest electric utilities in the U.S., serving nearly 5.4 million customer through seven operating companies across 11 states.  Jay joined AEP in their Audit Services Department in 2003, where he helped build an internal IT Audit function and robust Data Analytic capabilities.  Before joining AEP, Jay worked with Ernst & Young and help launch a service line focused on FDA regulatory compliance and consulting.  He earned his bachelor's and master's degrees from Indiana University.  When not exploring the world and collecting soccer jerseys, Jay resides in Columbus, Ohio with his wife as they try to keep track of their four daughters.

2.bio:
Keith Rajecki is senior director of Oracle's solutions for the global education and research industry. He is responsible for driving Oracle's strategy and industry solutions, and works with customers and partners to drive strategic initiatives. With more than 18 years in the education industry, he has developed and implemented technology solutions for every aspect of information technology, including one of the first elearning platforms as well as data center consolidation strategies.

Prior to joining Oracle, Rajecki was global solutions architect at Sun Microsystems, where he led the development of education industry solutions. In this role he worked to promote the development, adoption, and integration of Sun technologies to create technology solutions that met industry demands. Prior to entering the information technology industry, he held information technology leadership positions in higher education.

Because of his deep technical background and his expertise in education, Rajecki is often invited to speak about technology trends and solutions. He also serves as a trusted advisor to educational institutions and ministries around the world, and has published several papers on technology solutions.

Rajecki obtained both his bachelor and master of science degrees in computer information systems at Golden Gate University.

session.title: Create Tomorrow's Campus Today

2.bio:
Dr. Carter has been the Vice Chancellor of Information Technology/CIO at Houston Community College since 2006. He leads the strategic planning and budgeting ($19m Operating, $4m Capital Equipment and Projects), technology governance, and technical support efforts district wide. The departments under his leadership are Administrative Services, Core Information Services, Cyber Security and Networks, Campus Technology Servicesf.
 
From 2015 to 2017, Dr. Carter led HCC Institutional Research and Analytics departments until new leadership was hired. During that time, HCC won the Texas Best of Texas Award for Data Analytics/Business Intelligence and 2017 Innovation of the Year from the Center for Digital Government and League of Innovation respectively. 

Dr. Carter has been intricately involved in international initiatives in the Middle East and Southeast Asia. These initiatives include the design and implementation of the administrative and instructional technology and support departments for two campuses of the Community College of Qatar in Doha, Qatar; the pre-accreditation review of the Riyadh Community College in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia which lead to their successful accreditation under the National Commission for Academic Accreditation and Assessment; and the pre-accreditation review and successful accreditation of the Saigon Technical Institution in Ho Chi Minh City, Viet Nam under the Southern Association of Colleges and School.

Under Dr. Carter's leadership, Houston Community College has implemented innovative technologies that have saved the district over $33m and earned HCC the designation as a Top Ten Digital Community Colleges (2010, 2012, 2018) as well as recognitions and awards from Computerworld, University Business Magazine, Huffington Post, the American Association of Community Colleges, Cisco, Oracle, Campus Technology, and many others. He has also been intricately involved in the planning, design and completion of two capital improvement plans that resulted in the completion of 9 new campus and addition of over 2m square feet of administrative and instructional space, doubling the size of the college.    
While at HCC, Dr. Carter has represented HCC and served as a member or chair in the following:
•	Greater Houston Partnership Technology Infrastructure Committee 
•	Oracle Education and Research Industry Strategy Council (member)
•	Cyber Houston Task Force (member)
•	Texas Association of Community College Chief Information Officers (Past President)
•	Lonestar Education and Research Network (Chair - Governance Committee)
•	HISD – Eastwood Academy Advisory Board – Cyber Security Program (member)
Dr. Carter holds a Ph.D. in Higher Education Administration from The University of Texas at Austin, an M.B.A. and a B.B.A. in Management Information Systems from the University of Houston.

2.bio:
Tahir Yousaf is delivering transformational change as part of the realisation of the Birmingham City University digital portfolio by creating and leading high performing teams which deliver corporate change.

Tahir is passionate about the role of IT as an enabler and the ability of individuals to bridge the technical divide and deliver cutting edge solutions while maintaining solid commercial outcomes.

Having spent 20 years in technology tackling ever larger problems and enabling innovation through the delivery of IT strategies, Tahir has been instrumental in the delivery of large scale cloud and compliance solutions across telecoms and banking sectors for customers as broad as British Telecom, Eircom, BGC Partners and Bank of China.  

Tahir is a seasoned practitioner in Prince2 and Agile and has a breadth of experience and qualifications having implemented complex solutions with Microsoft, VMWare and Cisco technologies globally.

Tahir holds a BSc in Computer Science from Aston University in the UK.

2.bio:
Currently Mr. Driscoll is a VP within Oracle’s Higher Education Development organization. He arrived via Oracle’s acquisition of Vocado in April of 2018. At Vocado he was President & CEO responsible for its strategic direction, operational excellence and client satisfaction. He joined the Vocado management team in 2012 and focused its direction on optimizing the Higher Education Financial Aid Value chain. 

Previous to Vocado, his 29-year career with technology firms spans large companies: Intel and IBM; disruptive start-ups: Cymbolic Sciences Intl. and Viacore; and rapid change environments: Printrak Intl. and Partners Consulting. Mr. Driscoll has raised over $150 million in venture funding for start-ups, driven both organic and accretive growth, and engineered successful transitions to next business stage via IPO and M&A.

Mr. Driscoll has created value and streamlined operations in markets ranging from computer hardware, image processing software, SaaS for supply chain and educational applications and professional services for IT.

Throughout his career, Mr. Driscoll held positions of CEO, COO, or President, and has served on the Boards of both public and private firms.

2.bio:
Dr. Tonjia Coverdale is Vice President for Information Technology and Chief Information Officer at Central State University in Wilberforce, Ohio.  In her role, she is focused on strategic technology implementation for operational efficiencies and institutional effectiveness with an emphasis on the deployment of innovative, smart technology-based solutions to support student success, retention, and institutional growth and sustainability.  She has a passion for and dedicated commitment to increasing socioeconomic mobility through educational attainment via technology access.  Her current interest is the design and deployment of University IT infrastructure to support media-rich active learning classroom experiences delivered via telepresence to enhance virtual learning delivery and meet the ever-evolving needs of traditional and non-traditional students.

Dr. Coverdale is an IT executive, professional, and scholar who has cultivated her unique perspective of the field through the combination of academic theories, applied research, industry practices, and strategic focus.  She holds three degrees in information systems: BS and PhD from Morgan State University and an MBA from Georgia State University.  Dr. Coverdale has 21 years as an IT professional including roles with IBM, HP, Accenture, and President and CEO of the (U.S.) Virgin Islands Next Generation Network, where she completed the construction of one of the first 100% fiber-optic broadband networks in the U.S. to service an entire State/Territory.  Having pursued a dual career path in both industry and academia, she also has 17 years of experience in higher education as a University administrator and IT professor.  Dr. Coverdale is a member of the Oracle Education and Research Industry Strategy Council.

6.bio:
Stuart Davis serves as the Enterprise Chief Anti-Money Laundering Officer for BMO Financial Group for the past five years and is based in Toronto, Canada.  He has over 28 years banking and regulatory experience including 16 years in running AML programs. Previously he led the Global AML programs for USAA in San Antonio, Texas as well as for First Data Corporation, which included Western Union Financial Services and for Capital One.  Mr. Davis began his career with the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency and has also previously worked in risk and compliance functions at First Union and Bank of America.  
Mr. Davis has an honors degree in Economics from the University of Georgia.   He currently serves as the Chair of the Toronto Chapter of ACAMS, Chair of the Canadian Banker’s Association sub-committee on AML, and was recently appointed to a three-year term as a Co-Chair with Canada’s Department of Finance AML advisory and industry committee.  Mr. Davis also serves on the Board of Governors for Junior Achievement Central Ontario.
Mr. Davis is a frequent speaker on the topics of Know your Customer, Anti-Money Laundering, blockchain and virtual currency, and has spoken at the UN, Canada’s Parliamentary hearings, OECD in Paris, the FATF in China and other industry conferences globally.

6.globalBio: Sonny Singh has served as senior vice president and general manager of the Financial Services Global Business Unit at Oracle since 2013. In this role, Singh has worldwide responsibility for Oracle’s product portfolio for the financial services industry across banking, insurance, and capital markets. His organization spans all business functions including product strategy, research and development, mergers and acquisitions (M&A), sales, consulting, marketing, and customer service. In addition, his operational responsibilities include Oracle Financial Services Software (OFSS), a publicly held company, where he is a member of the Board of Directors.  Prior to his current role, Singh was the senior vice president responsible for all functions in Oracle's go-to-market strategy, including product marketing, competitive intelligence, field enablement, and M&A integration across Oracle's entire product and services portfolio. His organization delivered all of Oracle's strategic customer engagement capabilities, including solutions and expertise for all industry vertical segments; the Oracle Insight program, Oracle's branded value engineering competency; and Oracle Solution Centers. Additionally, his organization was responsible for the expert resources, tools, and capabilities for two key market segments: Oracle Key Accounts and Midsize.  Prior to that, Singh was group vice president for Oracle Consulting, where he led Oracle’s services business in North America Strategic Accounts. Singh began his Oracle career in 1990 and has had held a number of leadership roles in Oracle’s consulting and sales organizations, focusing on Oracle Applications.  Singh holds an MS in industrial engineering from Stanford University and a BS in mechanical engineering from Punjab University, India.

Mark Hetenyi: 
Earned his „Bachelor of Business Administration” degree, majoring in accountancy and economics, at the Georgetown University (USA) School of Business in 1997. Winner of the professional prize of the University.
Obtained his “Master of Science” degree, majoring in computer engineering, at the Santa Clara University (USA), School of Computer Engineering, in 2004. 
 
Started his career in 1997 at PriceWaterHouseCoopers Ltd. as Senior Accountancy and Advisory Manager. In addition to his auditing work he was in charge of complex, primarily M&A counselling tasks in Hungary and in Silicon Valley, California.
From 2005 he supervised a staff of more than 300 as regional vice president – director of finance of the units in Europe and the Middle East of Flextronics International, a multinational firm exceling in design, manufacturing and logistics.
Joined the team of the MKB Bank from February, 2015, first as deputy CEO, Finance and Operations then from 2016 as deputy CEO, Retail and Digital and has also been in charge of Strategy as well from 2017. After helping in the rehabilitation of the bank, its financial and cost structure, currently his key tasks include the digitalization of the bank, invigorating the Retail division and the introducing the Core system. Has been on the Board of the Bank since July 23, 2015.
Active in social and public life – served for 6 years as member of the Board of Directors of the American Chamber of Commerce and has supported the growth of volleyball for the 2nd year now working on the Board of the Hungarian Volleyball Federation.
Spends his free time with his family, his three children and wife, sports and reading.

8.bio:
Camillo Speroni is Vice President for Worldwide Strategic Alliances at Oracle. In this role, Mr. Speroni is responsible for all aspects of identifying and developing a market growth strategy, developing a robust set of Vertical Market Offerings, designing and implementing joint go-to-market strategies and identifying the financial and operational framework required to grow the current business and achieve Cloud leadership. His business responsibility is $150M+ of co-sell and re-sell of Oracle Cloud products. 

Mr. Speroni joined Oracle from CA Technologies where he was since June 2011. Prior to his current role, Mr. Speroni was VP Global Managed Service Providers and he managed these partnership holding the $100M+ business responsibility. Previously he was in charge of the $54M+ business associated to the global partnership with Accenture, focused on business development and joint IT investments in areas such as DevOps, Security and other key areas.  

He previously managed the Emerging Market business, transitioning select countries to a more efficient in-country franchise model and increasing customer and partner revenue, relationships, and driving mutual growth.  These areas included Russia, East Europe, Turkey, Middle East, Africa and more in and around Southeast Asia.  

Mr. Speroni’s previous experience includes a VP and GM roles at Novell, Inc. where he led Emerging Markets, Global Identity and Security Management and was also the President and GM of Latin America. 

He originally hails from Italy, but has lived and worked globally for 25+ years, speaking Italian, English, Spanish, Portuguese, and some basic French and Turkish.  Mr. Speroni holds a B.S. degree in Computer Science from The Illinois Institute of Technology. He currently lives in Chicago, Illinois with his wife and two sons.

Jim brings 30 years of experience working in corporate technology departments delivering analytic solutions that drive business success.  He is currently Vice President of Digital and Business Technology Innovation at Syneos Health, the leading organization providing Lab to Life™ contract research (CRO) and commercialization (CCO) services, where he focuses on driving better clinical trial outcomes through advanced analytic capabilities.  Previously, Jim was Vice President at Creativity Inc. and Executive Director at Verispan LLC where he led the development of the innovative VectorOne™ patient-centric analytical platform.  Jim has held various analytics roles at big pharma concerns such as Merck, Schering Plough, and Warner Lambert.

Jim earned his Bachelor of Science in Computer Science from Lehigh University (PA) and his MBA from Fairleigh Dickinson University (NJ).  Jim has also been an educator in various capacities, having earned his California Teaching Credential in High Mathematics from the University of Laverne (CA). 10.bio: Nely Galán is a self-made media mogul. Dubbed the Tropical Tycoon by the New York Times Magazine, she was the first Latina president of entertainment for a US television network (Telemundo). She is an Emmy Award–winning producer of more than 700 episodes of television in Spanish and English, which she produced through her multimedia company Galan Entertainment. Galán is the founder of the Adelante Movement, which seeks to empower multicultural women economically and entrepreneurially. She is the author of The NY Times bestselling book Self Made, Becoming Empowered, Self-Reliant, and Rich in Every Way (2016 Random House) about the revolution in women’s entrepreneurship led by multicultural women in the US and emerging women around the world. Her book has been published in English, Spanish, and Mandarin Chinese. Her next book, Don’t Buy Shoes Buy Buildings, comes out in 2019.

10.bio:
One of the most respected business executives in the NBA and a member of the Basketball Hall of Fame’s Class of 2018, Rick Welts has more than 40 years of experience in the league and has spent the last seven seasons as president and chief operating officer of the Golden State Warriors. In this role, reporting to owner and CEO Joe Lacob and owner Peter Guber, Welts oversees all business-related operations for the Warriors, including the development of the Chase Center, a privately financed sports and entertainment center in San Francisco’s Mission Bay neighborhood that broke ground in January 2017. He owns the rare distinction of being part of championship teams in the NBA (4), WNBA (2), and NBA G League (1). 
Under Welts’ direction, the organization has established several franchise benchmarks from a business standpoint in recent years, as the Warriors brand continues to grow in stature following four consecutive NBA Finals appearances and three NBA championships in 2015, 2017, and 2018. The organization has won numerous awards across all facets of the business in recent years, including the Warriors being named “Sports Team of the Year” across all sports in both 2014 and 2016 by the Sports Business Journal/Daily. The Warriors are the first professional team to win this coveted award twice. 
Welts’ impressive résumé includes myriad different capacities spanning virtually every level of an NBA operation. Prior to joining the Warriors in October 2011, he spent nine years as president of the Phoenix Suns. Welts’ responsibilities in Phoenix included the supervision of all business operations for the Suns, while also overseeing the team’s interest in the management of the US Airways Center and the WNBA’s Phoenix Mercury. 
After leaving the SuperSonics, the University of Washington graduate spent the following three years (1980–1982) at Bob Walsh & Associates, a sports marketing firm in the Seattle area. His non-NBA résumé also includes serving as president of Fox Sports Enterprises (1999–2000). 
In May of 2011, in a front-page story in the New York Times, Welts became the highest-ranking executive in men’s professional team sports to publicly acknowledge that he is gay. He was presented with a United States Tennis Association 2011 ICON Award at the US Open in New York City, an award that recognizes and celebrates those who have had a positive impact on diversity and inclusion in the sports industry and society. Also in 2011, he was honored with GLSEN’s (Gay, Lesbian, and Straight Education Network) Respect Award, which honors those who have made a difference in the areas of diversity and inclusion. In September 2014, he was honored by GLAAD, the nation’s LGBT media advocacy organization, with the Davidson/Valentini Award, which is presented to an LGBT media professional who has made a significant difference in promoting equality for the LGBT community. He also served as the celebrity Grand Marshall of San Francisco’s Pride Parade in 2015. In 2016 he was honored by the Anti-Defamation League with its “Torch of Liberty Award.” A member of Delta Chi fraternity while attending the University of Washington, in 2015 he was named “Delta Chi of the Year” by the national organization. 
Welts currently serves as a board member of the Bay Area Council and the Warriors Community Foundation. He is a member the NBA’s Team Advisory Committee and Global Inclusion Council.

11.bio: Jeffrey Wartgow leads Oracle’s Outbound product management teams focused on Oracle Service Cloud, Engagement Cloud, and ISV Partners. He and his teams are currently on a mission to predict the future of customer experience. Before joining Oracle, Jeff was with TOA Technologies (acquired by Oracle) where he served as the vice president of product marketing, as well as vice president of channels and alliances. Before joining TOA, Jeffrey spent two and a half years as a Director at FTI Consulting in San Francisco, where he was charged with developing the company’s first formal partner program. Prior to FTI, Jeffrey served seven years with Dell Inc. During this time he managed Dell’s Strategic Alliances for Europe, the Middle East and Africa as well as Dell’s New Partner Evaluation program. Jeffrey also led Dell’s Competitive Intelligence team focusing on enterprise products. With more than 15 years of experience in diverse roles across the technology industry, Jeffrey is an expert on mobility, predictive analytics, big data, enterprise cloud computing, technology ecosystems, partnerships and integrations, and the dynamic relationship between hardware, software and services in enterprise IT architecture.

15.bio:
As senior vice president and general manager of Oracle Communications, Doug Suriano is responsible for managing strategic planning, product development, sales, service, and support for Oracle Communications products.

He joined Oracle in 2013 as vice president of products for Oracle Communications following the Tekelec acquisition. In this role, Suriano oversaw product development and product management for the network signaling and policy management product portfolio. At Tekelec, he served as chief technology officer and vice president of engineering. In these capacities he focused on developing Tekelec's solutions for the mobile broadband era. During his ten-year tenure, Suriano was responsible for product innovation, leadership in standards bodies and industry forums, and advocacy for innovative mobile data solutions. He successfully led initiatives to transition Tekelec from hardware-centric products to software-centric applications and to expand the market share of the company's data and voice solutions. Suriano also headed the development of Tekelec's Diameter Signaling Router (DSR), the first product of its kind sold to LTE network operators.

Prior to Tekelec, Suriano was the vice president of engineering at dynamicsoft, Inc. and chief information officer for QAD, Inc. Before QAD, he managed the information technology division for the United States Marine Corps.

Suriano earned an MS in information technology at the US Naval Postgraduate School and a BS at the US Naval Academy.

15.bio:
Emma McGuigan
Group Technology Officer – Communications, Media and Technology, Accenture
Emma McGuigan is the Group Technology Officer for Accenture’s Communications, Media and Technology operating group. In this role, Emma is responsible for the group’s technology strategy, overseeing current and future partnerships, and positioning around emerging technologies such as machine learning, artificial intelligence and cognitive computing to help drive leading-edge technology consulting and innovation to clients. 

Emma has been with Accenture for more than 20 years, joining Accenture after graduating with a Master’s degree in Electronics from the University of Edinburgh in 1994. She is passionate about technology and has spent her career architecting and delivering technology enabled solutions to clients in a range of industries.  Growing up with a variety of technologies from across the ecosystem, custom through packaged, Emma has worked with clients on programs from the cutting edge of innovation to large scale core solutions.

She has been recognised several times as an industry influencer as a result of her passion for technology and dedication to inspire young women to embark on Science, Technology, Engineering and Maths careers. In 2015 and 2016, Emma was named as one of the 50 most influential women in UK IT by Computer Weekly magazine, was listed in Computer Business Review’s 10 most successful women in UK technology and was the Forward Ladies National Women in Business STEM category winner 2016. In 2012 she was the technology category winner of Women in the City's Woman of Achievement Awards.

In 2013, Emma was made a fellow of The Chartered Institute for IT. She currently serves as a board member of techUK, advisory board member of Digital Leaders and industry advisory board member for the Open University Maths and Computing Science department.

Outside Accenture, Emma is a keen triathlete, a trustee for the Orchid Project and a business advisor to a sustainable development charity.

17.bio:
Gretchen Alarcon is group vice president for Oracle’s human capital management strategy, responsible for development and go-to-market initiatives that help businesses around the world modernize their HR practices through the adoption of Oracle’s HCM cloud apps. Additionally, Alarcon acts as a thought leader, highlighting trends and strategic initiatives in businesses’ transition to the cloud. With more than 20 years’ experience in product strategy, Alarcon uses her knowledge of the industry to showcase the importance of modernization through the integration of cloud apps in core HR, talent acquisition, and HR data analytics. Together with her team, she forecasts future of work movements and delivers initiatives to businesses to protect their bottom line. 

Prior to Oracle, Alarcon worked at Icarian, National Semiconductor, Ford, and Silicon Graphics, where she drove the management of workforce suites and aided in the redesign of worldwide human resource functions.

Alarcon holds an MBA from the University of Michigan and a BA in American Studies from Stanford University.

17.bio: Elina Petrillo is the Assistant Vice President for HR Technology at Northwell Health.  She brings more than fifteen years of experience in the design and implementation of complex human resource technology solutions for HR enterprises. She is an HR executive responsible for HR Technology operations, the implementation of Kronos and the automation of HR practices into applications employees use every day.  She leads substantial and systemic human capital strategies designed to deliver outstanding business results. Elina was also an adjunct Professor at Adelphi University teaching courses on Project management for Healthcare Organizations. Previously, Elina was a business solution Consultant at Accenture, helping to create and deliver the “next generation” of Human Capital Management solutions. She has been a guest speaker at HIUG Annual conferences about best practices for integration between PeopleSoft HRMS and Kronos and the automation of Licenses/Certifications.  Elina is a graduate of Syracuse University and resides in Long Island, N.Y.

17.bio:
Shahbaz  Alibaig Speaker Profile
Senior Director, Head of Global HR Operations, Talent Acquisition, HRIS and Analytics
Esterline Technologies, Seattle, Washington, USA
Shahbaz Alibaig is a senior global human resources leader with over 18 years of experience in the areas of global talent recruitment, HR, Six Sigma and project management. In his current role, he is leading HR Operations, Talent Acquisition and HRIS team at Esterline and implementing cloud based HR solutions like Oracle HCM, Taleo and Tableau and implementing global shared services. Shahbaz recently  led multiple efforts in regards to deployment of Synchrony Financial’ s (formally GE Capital)  independent HR systems and services as well as leading HR Change Management initiatives including implementation of Workday HCM and Cornerstone LMS. Shahbaz and Esterline team currently implementing Smashfly (Recruitment Marketing), Oracle Recruit (ATS) and Oracle Learn (LMS).
Shahbaz moved to Esterline after working for GE for over five years where he was the global recruitment technology manager. Under Alibaig's leadership, GE implemented innovative TR practices around recruitment. Some of his global projects included implementation of Video Interviewing, Candidate Relationship Management, and Hiring Manager/Candidate Survey NPS Surveys. Shahbaz writes articles on LinkedIn which can be viewed on his LinkedIn profile.


Shahbaz is a certified Talent Acquisition Strategist, PMP certified, Six Sigma Master Black Belt, ISO Lead Auditor and one of the few highly selective Entrepreneurship Operating System Certified Implementer.  Shahbaz has been a keynote speaker at several HR and Talent Acquisition Conference in US and Europe.
Twitter:@shahbazalibaig
LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/in/shahbazalibaig/

17.bio:
Amit Vyas
Asst. Vice President, Oracle Solutions Practice, Enterprise Applications, Cognizant

Amit leads Cloud Advisory for Cognizant’s Oracle Solutions Practice in North America.  Amit is an experienced Vice President with extensive sales, delivery and management experience.  Over a 30 year career he has built a track record of achievement, including 20 years at Oracle in consulting leadership roles.    Amit has served as a sales executive and sponsor for numerous transformational and multi-pillar projects leveraging his business and IT insights as a thought leader.  Amit’s IT consulting background spans On Premise and Cloud/SaaS ERP, CX and HCM applications, enterprise architecture, BI/Analytics, change management and managed services.  His Industry expertise spans several verticals including Manufacturing, Banking & Insurance, Higher Education, Healthcare, Retail, High Tech and Media & Entertainment.  Amit has a Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering from IIT Roorkee, India and a Master’s in Business (MIS) from the University of Arizona.

Senior Vice President
Oracle Applications Development
Paco Aubrejuan is Senior Vice President of Development for Oracle Applications Development. His team is responsible for all aspects of application delivery and maintenance for key Oracle solutions. Prior to this role, Mr. Aubrejuan was Vice President of Industry Product Strategy, responsible for defining the product roadmap for industry solutions across the JD Edwards, PeopleSoft, Siebel, and Oracle lines of business. Mr. Aubrejuan joined Oracle through the PeopleSoft acquisition in 2005. 
Prior to PeopleSoft, Mr. Aubrejuan was a Senior Manager at Accenture, a leading professional services consulting firm. He was responsible for business and IT strategy, change management, and application implementation within Accenture's Communication Industry group. 
Mr. Aubrejuan has a bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering from University of California at Santa Barbara.

Andy Jordan is a contributor to ProjectManagement.com and President of Roffensian Consulting, a Roatan, Honduras based project focused management consulting firm. 20.bio:
Michael Sherwood is the Director of Technology and Innovation for the City of Las Vegas.  Sherwood has more than 20 years of management experience, specifically in the field of technology, process improvement and innovation with the majority of that experience being in municipal government operations. Most recently he served as the deputy director of public safety, business services and city technology for the city of Irvine, CA since December 2013. In that capacity he was responsible for budgets of both public safety at $70 million and technology at $8 million. He was responsible for more than 100 professional, technical employees and contractors. In that role he developed and implemented key technology strategies that reduced the annual technology operating costs by more than $1 million. He also provided key leadership in bringing Google Fiber to the city.

 

Prior to that position, Sherwood served as the manager of business services for the City of Irvine, CA from 2012-2013, the chief information officer for City of Oceanside, CA, from 2001-2012 and the information technologies manager for the City of Oceanside, CA from 1997-2000. Before 1997, he served in the private sector. 

 

Sherwood earned his Bachelor of Science in Management from Pepperdine University followed by a Master of Science in Executive Management from the University of Southern California.

20.bio: Michael Jamison is Deputy CFO of Financial Planning and Analysis for the City of Detroit. He also previously served as a Mayoral appointee on and Trustee of the City of Detroit Police and Fire Retirement System.  Prior to his current position, he served as Deputy Finance Director for the City of Detroit and has also held positions with Energy Conversion Devices, P&M Corporate Finance, Lehman Brothers, Wachovia and Booz Allen Hamilton. Mr. Jamison has extensive experience in organizational restructuring, investment banking, corporate finance, municipal finance, commercial banking and financial planning & analysis, among others. Mr. Jamison received his BA from the University of Michigan, MS from the University of Wisconsin-Madison and MBA from the University of Virginia. He is a graduate of Leadership Detroit Class XXXVII and is a member of Government Finance Officers Association, Association for Financial Professionals and the National Black MBA Association.

20.bio:
Rob Lloyd is CIO for the City of San José, California, directing the diverse civic technology portfolio of the nation’s tenth largest municipality. 

The City organization consists of 6,600 employees and carries a $3.5 billion total budget, all serving over one million residents and 85,000 businesses in the heart of Silicon Valley. San Jose is defined by its innovative partnerships with the World’s leading companies and non-profits, as well as for being the leanest large municipality in the country. The City’s quest: To be as innovative as the community we serve.

Over two decades, Rob has held C-level roles in the technology, government, and utilities sectors in California, Arizona, Oregon, and Colorado. He and his teams have earned over 20 national awards for customer engagement, attaining operational excellence through technology, and for innovative programs.

22.bio: Tomas Ulin has been working with the MySQL Database team since 2003, and is currently employed by Oracle, based in Sweden. He is Vice President for the MySQL Engineering team, responsible for the development and maintenance of the MySQL related software products within Oracle, such as the MySQL Server, MySQL Cluster, MySQL Connectors, MySQL Workbench, MySQL Enterprise Backup, and MySQL Enterprise Monitor. Prior to working with MySQL he has a background in the telecom industry, working for the Swedish telecom operator Telia and Telecom vendor Ericsson. He has a Masters degree in Computer Science and Applied Physics from Case Western Reserve University and a PhD in Computer Science from the Royal Institute of Technology.

session.title: The State of Dolphin

22.bio:
Rich Mason, Senior Vice President & General Manager,  MySQL GBU.

Rich was promoted to GM for the MySQL Global Business Unit in July 2015, and is responsible for leading product management, engineering, field marketing, support and sales for the MySQL business at Oracle.   Prior to that Rich led MySQL Sales since November 2008.   Rich reports to Edward Screven, Oracle EVP & Chief Corporate Architect who is on Larry Ellison's staff.  Rich is now in his 14th year with the MySQL business.

In this journey, MySQL has matured from a small European database start-up to become the most popular open source database in the market today.  MySQL now has over 20,000 commercial customers and powers business critical applications all around the world in retail stores, gaming companies, mobile service provider cellular networks, governments, the most popular web-properties you can name, most public cloud providers, and is embedded within thousands of software and appliance product lines from over two thousand ISVs and OEMs.

Prior to joining MySQL AB in 2005,  Rich served in various UK and EMEA software sales leadership roles with Sun Microsystems, Forte Software, Oracle, and Ingres.  When he is not working, Rich’s interests include family, music, skiing and motorsport.

23.bio:
As a Vice President within Oracle's Cloud Business Group, Monica leads global marketing and sales programs for Oracle’s flagship Database and Big Data Cloud portfolio. A veteran technology executive, she’s an expert in building, retaining and motivating teams for maximum performance. She believes that "empathy" is the most critical leadership trait and "managing" an organization is not the same as "leading" them.

Monica draws inspiration from her incredible family and friends who give her unconditional and non-judgmental support to strive to become a better person and excel in her career. Monica is passionate about supporting women to pursue an education and career in STEM. She was awarded as one of the 2017 Powerful Women of the Bay by CDA Consulting Group as well as 2017 Women of Influence by The Silicon Valley Business Journal in recognition for being passionate about educating, empowering, and connecting with women in business and the community. 25.bio:
Senior Director, CX Product Strategy

Over the last decade, I've partnered with B2C and B2B online businesses of all sizes - from Top 500 companies to boutique vendors - to navigate some of the biggest industry shakeups digital professionals have faced in recent memory. The digital space and ecommerce have put me on teams and given me opportunities that continually force me to strive to find my limits and then go beyond them to develop and understand the best product strategy for our customers. I work for and with my customers and partners in a landscape that is always changing, where we are all constantly juggling changing business priorities and consumer demands. I have one of the most fun and innovative team at Oracle that focuses on Digital Customer Solutions. We sit within product development and collaborate across many internal teams touching customer success, competitive intelligence, sales, marketing, campaigns, press, analysts, sales, education, and partners to bring new products to market in the digital arena.
